Factsheet

StarCitizen Tracker

Description

StarCitizen Tracker attempts to fact-check Chris Roberts and Cloud Imperium Games Corporation to see if they adhere to the expectations set concerning the record breaking kickstarter project "Star Citizen" and it's accompanying single player mode "Squadron 42". The tracker is a crowdsourced endeavor started on April 17th, 2017 and may contain inaccuracies. It is not an attempt to measure progress.

History and Information

Origin

StarCitizen Tracker was forked from TrumpTracker due to it's useful sorting mechanism and flexible ability to scale a wide assortment of links into a condensed list. The code was retrofit to accept input from a Google spreadsheet allowing for collaborative editing from multiple authors.

Inspiration

The tracker is inspired by a list that went by the name 'Where's the No Man's Sky we were sold on?' which listed a shocking number of absent features players were expecting. The large scope and long development time of Star Citizen make conducting an audit post release difficult to impossible; thus compiling prior to commercial release makes sense. This puts valuable information into backers hands now, who are currently the major stakeholders of the project.

Editors

This project would not be possible without a few dedicated Editors. They review crowdsourced feedback and scour the web for expectations set by Cloud Imperium Games concerning the "Star Citizen" and "Squadron 42" titles. Although this tracker is attributed to Goons of the SomethingAwful forums, most Goons are very lazy and the most Editors were recruited from other gaming forums. Editors are expected to leave any bias over the controversial development at the door and only organize factual information.

Core Tenets

Completeness, Clarity, and Accuracy

Anonymity

The original author of 'Where's the No Man's Sky we were sold on?' was intimidated and tormented by vindictive players. Cloud Imperium Games Corporation has cultivated a certain type of backer mentality that is often not tolerant of criticism which can often be perceived when comparing the former and future expectations with the current reality. Perhaps because of the large investments some backers have made, a sizeable portion continue to make their favorite game very serious business and attack those who do not embrace Star Citizen with the same level of enthusiasm. Anyone contributing to StarCitizen Tracker is encouraged to use aliases when speaking about the tracker or editing the Google sheet. We request that any and all personal details of contributors are not publicized.

Goals

Some Editors hope this list encourages the developers to complete each feature and worry less about reworking every asset to perfection. Others are just looking to improve the visualization of the of the feature list.
